intro: Linaria capraria, commonly known as the goat's beard, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a herbaceous annual or biennial plant that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant produces bright yellow or orange flowers that are often described as resembling a beard, hence its common name. Its flowers are borne in dense spikes and are known for their attractive, tubular shape. Linaria capraria thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes.
